segments.text: Do you have a copy of today ’ s newspaper ? I want to check the results from the world athletics championship .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I ‘ m just reading them myself . It ’ s been a great competition . We got gold medals in three events .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , we won the men ’ s 110 metres hurdles . I watched that on TV . What other events did we win ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We won the men ’ s high jump and the women ’ s 1500 meters .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s great . Those athletes must train for years to get into peak physical condition . They must be terribly disappointed if they don ’ t win .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The woman who won the 1500 meters also broke the world record by 2 seconds .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s amazing ! Were any other records broken ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: A Russian man broke the discus record by a centimeters . Out best athlete broke his personal best in the long jump , but it only got him third place .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Did you see the final of the men ’ s 100 metres ? It was very exciting . One competitor made two false starts .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , he was . I imagine he must be very angry with himself for that .
segments.speaker: S1
